text:
hey guys welcome to a new 
episode of just rolled in

the owner of his vehicle had it towed 
in as he said it won't start after he

installed these chrome trim pieces in 
his truck this one Chrome piece on the

ignition lock cylinder blocked the signal 
transmission between the transponder in

the key and the antenna ring and once it 
was removed the customer's truck started

and this customer brought in their 
vehicle as they want a steering and
suspension check as the steering wheel seems loose

customer States vehicle runs rough and 
does not drive over 35 miles per hour

the technician is not sure how the 
coolant reservoir cap got stuck into

the throttle body but the customer's 
truck does have a brand new water pump

and this customer's pickup was towed in 
as they had a catastrophic engine failure

the customer said they started to hear 
a knock around 1 000 miles ago so they

started to put thicker oils in the engine to 
try and stop the knock the customer told the

technician he started with 5w40 then 10w40 
then 15W40 and finally tried 75 w90 gear oil

customer States all the dash lights turned 
on then the vehicle died while driving and it

just happened once the battery hold down 
was left loose from the parts store who

installed it and it managed to touch the 
positive battery terminal while driving

this customer's vehicle was towed 
in as they said they replaced the

battery. starter and some sensors 
and the vehicle still does not start

and this customer brought in their vehicle as they 
had poured gasoline in the washer fluid reservoir

this vehicle was brought in after the 
customer drove over a piece of metal

on the highway the customer fortunately 
didn't sustain any injuries as a piece of

metal went through the center console 
and destroyed the shifter assembly

when this customer's trailer came in to get 
new tires the mechanic noticed that the trailer

coupling was only held in place with these two 
bolts and the trailer brakes did not work as well

customer States the new power steering 
pump they installed does not work the
customer never reinstalled the serpentine belt and

use a wheel stud instead of a banjo 
bolt for the power steering line

the viewer who shared this clip 
to this customer's vehicle had

a broken power steering rack which 
caused this Ghost Rider situation
man got Hood clips connected to [ __ ] push pin

and this customers lifted Dodge Challenger came 
in to get the rear differential repaired the shop

has yet to do any work on this customer's 
vehicle as a custom lift kit they installed

isn't very safe because the customer had 
even cut the control arms to make it work

and this customer brought in their vehicle as 
they said the brake pedal is soft after they

installed the new brake lines the technician 
isn't quite sure what the customer was trying

to do but they installed new lines to the rear of 
their vehicle and bypassed the rear brake lines

and also had brake fluids leaking from multiple 
spots when this customer came in to get new lower

control arms installed the mechanic noticed that 
the customer had spray foamed Every Spring and

strut the customer had even spray foamed a piece 
of wood in place underneath their vehicle as well
I hope you enjoyed this video and please consider

leaving a like or subscribing if you 
haven't already thanks for watching
